description: In a landscape featuring a hill occupied by figures on horseback, a man on a horse in the foreground approaches two other men on horseback. The arriving man is conspicuously impaled with numerous arrows protruding from his back and torso. Despite this severe injury, the two waiting figures appear calm, anticipating a verbal report from the impaled man. The scene presents an absurd juxtaposition of extreme physical trauma with a casual, almost bureaucratic, expectation of communication, highlighting a surreal indifference to the dire situation.
caption: “Now stay calm. ... Let’s hear what they said to Bill.”
